channel.title: Ipconfig
channel.description:
When in cmd , i type ipconfig , and this comes up : 'ipconfig' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
My friend says this :
cd C:\WINDOWS\system32
You've removed the C:\windows\system32 from your PATH variable.
To do ipconfig do this,
cd C:\WINDOWS\system32 ipconfig
---
So , how i put the path thing back to my variables , so i wont have to type that C:\WINDOWS\system32 all the time !

item.title: Ipconfig
item.dc:creator: @Word_Life Word Life
item.description:
@Word_Life wrote:

[quote=“ameer122, post:2, topic:358137”]type

ipconfig/all[/quote]

2 things:

  1. Have you set your environment variables?

  2. Go to Start>Run and type C:\WINDOWS\system32\cmd.exe then hit enter. Then type ipconfig /all

Read full topic

item.title: Ipconfig
item.dc:creator: @flashsnakz flashsnakz
item.description:
@flashsnakz wrote:

When in cmd , i type ipconfig , and this comes up : ‘ipconfig’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.

My friend says this :

cd C:\WINDOWS\system32

You’ve removed the C:\windows\system32 from your PATH variable.

To do ipconfig do this,

cd C:\WINDOWS\system32
ipconfig

So , how i put the path thing back to my variables , so i wont have to type that C:\WINDOWS\system32 all the time !
